Questions.daily_plants_consumption: How many plants do you consume daily? Plants include fruits, vegetables, grains, legumes, and nuts.
Questions.health_goal_question: Which health goal is most important to you? You can add more goals later.
Questions.health_goal_4: Heart Health (avoiding heart attacks, strokes, high blood pressure, etc.)
Questions.height_question: What is your height? We use your height to compare it with thousands of people who participated in Gutricious clinical studies.
Questions.weight_question: What is your weight? We ask this question, regardless of your interest in weight loss, to provide more accurate calculations for your heart health.
Questions.weight_goal_question: Do you have a weight goal? We ask this question to understand what motivates you.
Questions.desired_weight_question: What weight would you like to reach? Although calorie restriction may lead to rapid weight loss initially, studies show that those who are more successful in maintaining weight loss are those who lose it gradually and steadily (about 450-900g per week).
Questions.birth_sex_question: What sex were you assigned at birth? We ask this question because our research shows that women and men metabolize food very differently.
Questions.gender_identity_question: With which gender do you identify? Some people do not identify with the sex assigned at birth. Therefore, we ask about your gender to address you correctly.
Questions.pregnancy_question: Are you pregnant? We ask this question because currently, Gutricious cannot support pregnant individuals. We hope to conduct future scientific studies to understand nutrition during pregnancy.
Questions.age_group_question: What is your age group? If you feel that your body responds to food differently than when you were younger, you are correct!
Questions.antibiotics_usage_question: Frequent use of antibiotics can affect the bacteria in your gut. Have you taken antibiotic medications more than once in the last three years (not on the skin)?
Questions.energy_crash_question: Our research shows that poor blood sugar control often affects women in their 60s. How often do you experience energy crashes during the day?
Questions.energy_crash_rarely: Rarely or never. I almost always have energy.
Questions.energy_crash_sometimes: Sometimes, I am tired and need an energy boost.
Questions.energy_crash_frequently: Frequently, I am tired and low on energy.
Questions.exercise_question: Exercise alters the metabolism of women in their 60s. How often do you engage in 20 minutes or more of exercise that raises your heart rate?
Questions.menopause_status_question: Have you gone through menopause (choose only one)? Our researchers have found significant changes in how we metabolize food during and after menopause.
Questions.menopause_status_post: Post-menopause (meaning your menstrual periods have stopped for at least a year and have not resumed)
Questions.health_condition_question: Do you have any of the following conditions?
Questions.health_condition_eating_disorder: Eating disorder (e.g., anorexia nervosa or bulimia nervosa)
Questions.health_condition_intestinal_disease: Intestinal disease (e.g., Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, or celiac disease)
Questions.health_condition_major_surgery: Major surgery in the last 2 months or a history of heart attack, stroke, or transient ischemic attack
Questions.diabetes_status_question: Has a doctor ever told you that you have diabetes or pre-diabetes?
Questions.diabetes_family_history_question: Do any of your parents or siblings have diabetes?
Questions.cvd_diagnosis_question: Have you ever been diagnosed with cardiovascular disease (e.g., heart attack, heart disease, or stroke) or high cholesterol levels?
Questions.family_cvd_question: Do any of your parents or siblings have cardiovascular disease?
Questions.hypertension_status_question: Has a doctor ever told you that you have high blood pressure?
Questions.hypertension_medication_question: Do you take prescribed medications to treat high blood pressure?
Questions.knowledge_of_gutricious_question: How long have you known about Gutricious?
Questions.ensure_submit: Are you sure you want to submit?
Questions.Do any of your parents or siblings have: Do any of your parents or siblings have cardiovascular disease?

Steps.step_1_description: Your personalised test kit is on its way! Inside, you'll find a glucose monitor, a finger-prick lipid test, and a microbiome stool sample kit. Look out for its arrival soon.
Steps.step_2_description: Help us understand your lifestyle and dietary habits by filling out the detailed questionnaire in the app. This is crucial for tailoring your assessment accurately.
Steps.step_3_description: Follow the instructions in your kit to collect your glucose, lipid, and microbiome samples. Accurate collection ensures the best results for your assessment.
Steps.send_your_samples_to_the_lab: Send Your Samples to the Lab
Steps.step_4_description: Carefully package your collected samples and send them back to our lab using the pre-paid return envelope. This step is vital for your personalised analysis.
Steps.step_5_description: Our lab experts will analyse your samples, including continuous glucose monitoring data, lipid profile, and microbiome analysis. Your personalised nutrition assessment will be available shortly in the app, revealing the foods best suited to your body's needs.

Navigation.description_heading: A blog created with Next.js and Tailwind.css
